moves.2... Nf6: According to Game DB, this is QGD (D06), Marshall defence. Most people defend with the e6, I prefer with the knight, as it doesn't block in my bishop on the second move, and if I need to, I can just protect with e6 later.
moves.4. a3: I guess this move is played to stop black from playing Bb4, pinning the knight, but I would prefer Bg5, continuing with the Gambit, or Nf3.
moves.4... c5 5. dxc5: Takes?? Now, I have two centre pawns to one. Better: e3 or Nf3.
moves.5... Bxc5: I have developed two pieces to white's one.
moves.6. Bg5: Pinning my knight to my queen.
moves.6... O-O 7. cxd5 exd5 8. Nxd5: (?) Loses a knight for a pawn.
moves.10. Rxd1 gxf6: I am now up +2 with my bishop developed, and my king safely castled (Except now open to the g-file).
moves.11... Nc6 12. Bc4 Be6: Not wanting doubled pawns, I offer a swap.
moves.13... Rfd8: The white rook no longer owns this file.
moves.16. O-O Ne5: Again, I offer a swap to un-double my pawns (If that's a word).
moves.17. b4 Be7 18. Nd4 Bc4: Threatening the rook. I also see a possibility of: 19. Re1 a4 20. bxa4 Bxa3. Threatening Bb4, trapping the rook.
moves.19. Re1 a5 20. Nf5: Threatening my bishop. Unless I want to swap (I don't) my only option is Bf8.
moves.23... Ra8: (!) Now, if Rxb4, then: 24. Ra1+ 25. Rb1 Rxb1 26. Bd1 Rxd1#
moves.25. h4 Bd3: I'm tired of pressing shift+1. A fork.
moves.28. Nxf7: At least he gets a pawn.
moves.30... Ra1+ 31. Kh2 Rh1#: Phew! Finally the game is over, and as I look at my profile, I have a new highest rated player won against. Thanks for reading, hope you enjoyed. I'm about to start annotating some games from a recent tournament, good luck with all your games!
